Package org.concordion.cubano.driver.web

Class BasePageObject<T extends BasePageObject<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.concordion.cubano.driver.web.BasePageObject<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Class of the PageObject extending this class, so that we can implement fluent style methods

    public abstract class BasePageObject<T extends BasePageObject<T>>
extends java.lang.Object

    Provides core functionality for pages objects using the page object factory pattern.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BasePageObject

        protected BasePageObject(BrowserBasedTest test,
                         int timeoutWaitInSeconds,
                         java.lang.Object... params)

        Creates a new page object.

        Parameters:
        test - Calling class
        timeoutWaitInSeconds - Maximum time to wait for page to finish loading
        params - An optional set of parameters to pass to the waitUntilPageIsLoaded method

    • Method Detail

      • refreshPageElements

        public void refreshPageElements()

        Updates all fields in this class (and descendant classes) with new pointers to the elements on the webpage we’re pointing at.

        This is useful in the event that an Ajax request has reloaded large portions of your page and to avoid StaleElementExcpetions it is easier just to refresh all fields that work out which ones need updating.

      • waitUntilPageIsLoaded

        protected abstract void waitUntilPageIsLoaded(int timeoutWaitInSeconds,
                                              java.lang.Object... params)

        Has two purposes:

        • Check that an element on the page that uniquely identifies this page is present
        • Ensure that the page is fully loaded (eg Ajax requests have completed) so don’t have to implement waits when accessing elements on the page

        All PageObjects must implement this method.

        Parameters:
        timeoutWaitInSeconds - Number of seconds to wait for the page to load before timing out
        params - List of parameters passed to the constructor, if any

      • getSimpleName

        public java.lang.String getSimpleName()
        Returns:

        by - How to find the element
        Returns:

      • capturePage

        protected T capturePage(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element)

        Notify listener that it should take a screenshot of the current page.

        A default description is constructed assuming that a click is about to be performed on an element in the format: Clicking '<element text>'

        Parameters:
        element - Element to highlight, or null if not applicable
        Returns:
        A self reference

      • capturePage

        public T capturePage(java.lang.String description)

        Notify listener that it should take a screenshot of the current page.

        Parameters:
        description - Description to include with screenshot
        Returns:
        A self reference

      • capturePageAndClick

        public <P extends BasePageObject<P>> P capturePageAndClick(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                                                           java.lang.Class<P> expectedPage)

        Notify listener that it should take a screenshot of the current page and then click the supplied element and return a new instance of the expected page.

        A default description is constructed in the format: Clicking '<element text>'

        Type Parameters:
        P - The type of the desired page object
        Parameters:
        element - Element to click
        expectedPage - Class of page that should be returned
        Returns:
        new PageObject of type expectedPage

      • capturePageAndClick

        public <P extends BasePageObject<P>> P capturePageAndClick(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                                                           java.lang.String description,
                                                           java.lang.Class<P> expectedPage)

        Notify listener that it should take a screenshot of the current page and then click the supplied element and return a new instance of the expected page.

        Type Parameters:
        P - The type of the desired page object
        Parameters:
        element - Element to click
        description - Description of the action being taken
        expectedPage - Class of page that should be returned
        Returns:
        new PageObject of type expectedPage

      • newInstance

        public <P extends BasePageObject<P>> P newInstance(java.lang.Class<P> expectedPage)

        Helper method for creating new page objects from an expected class

        Requires that the expectedPage extends from PageObject and has a public constructor with a single parameter of TestDriveable.

        Type Parameters:
        P - The type of the desired page object
        Parameters:
        expectedPage - Page that should be returned
        Returns:
        New instance of supplied page object

      • getFirstVisibleElement

        protected org.openqa.selenium.WebElement getFirstVisibleElement(java.util.List<org.openqa.selenium.WebElement> webElements)

        Find the first visible element in a list.

        Parameters:
        webElements - list of elements to search through
        Returns:
        A visible WebElement or null if no visible elements in list

      • prepareForScreenshot

        public void prepareForScreenshot()

        Override this method to implement any code that needs to be run prior to taking a screen shot, eg fixing floating headers.

      • waitUntil

        protected void waitUntil(org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.ExpectedCondition<?> condition,
                         int timeOutInSeconds)

        A convenience method for executing ExpectedConditions.

        Parameters:
        condition - The expected condition
        timeOutInSeconds - how long to wait for the expected condition to evaluate to true
        Throws:
        org.openqa.selenium.TimeoutException - If the timeout expires

      • switchToMainDocument

        public void switchToMainDocument()

        Similar to WebDriver’s switchTo().WebDriver.TargetLocator.defaultContent() but will always select the main document when a page contains iframes.

      • getCurrentFrameNameOrId

        public java.lang.String getCurrentFrameNameOrId()

        Get the current frame’s name or id property.

        Returns:
        Empty string if main document selected otherwise will return name property if set, id property if set, else ‘UNKNOWN FRAME’ for selected iframe.
